Description: Painted limestone shabti of Naherhu with a black jackal's head(damaged), a yellow collar, a pectoral bearing a black scarab and red parallel hands holding red hoes; the leg section is inscribed with a central column of black painted Hieroglyphs flanked by five similar rows.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Condition: incomplete - damage to the muzzle and ears
